Description: Fragment of wall of Attic red-figured pottery open vase, perhaps cup; handle root part preserved. Inside glazed; outside, female, elaborately dressed, most of mid-body preserved; trace of figure to the right; to left, beneath handle perhaps seated figure in spotted garment. Repair hole lower right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 108 no. 381 pl. 80)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2124)
